answers.answer: Yes me! 19 weeks and diebetic.How you finding it

I am hypoglycemic. Have been since birth. I don't have much issue with my sugar ever getting high. But been having more issues with it dropping since I been pregnant and went in to a seizure once from it.
Type 1 or 2? I have type 1 and my blood sugar is still low all the time
I am 18 weeks and I'm type 2 diabetic.

Thanks for all msgs. I am type 2.Right nnow my sugar level is slightly higher but it is not serious one. I am diabetic since 4yrs and earlier I had miscarriage two times.So this time taking care very much.
Have you changed your diet any more since becoming pregnant? For some reason now when I drink milk my blood sugar will absolutely shoot up like crazy and I've never had any issue with it before

I have not thought about milk will increase the sugar level. Of course I have changed the diet. I have included few fruits, vegetables and protein foods which I have not included earlier. I fear milk increasing my sugar. But due to few options I have can't think to stop it. Probably I have to reduce the quantity.Please share others too.
I've just been drinking a lot less at a time. That's has helped me a lot
Sorry, I can't understand that.Have you reduced or what?
I find milk raises my sugar levela too  . Cant even eat a bowl of cearal wihtout it going up to 9. Im trying so hard .
I find milk raises my sugar levela too  . Cant even eat a bowl of cearal wihtout it going up to 9. Im trying so hard .
Yes, I've reduced. I've gone from drinking 1 or 2 glasses at a time to just half of one
I am veggies and I have very limited choices for food.What do you feel?

question: Girls, hope all of you must be enjoying your motherhood experience.I am in the 18th week with diabetes.Anyone else who is also like me?
title: Diabetic FTM in 18th week
